Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find the tensions of the day go away when I run a few miles before dark. The light is different, I hear new things and smell new odors like a fireplace burning oakwood. Sometimes I find that dogs are not man's best friend. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We're home three weekends a year. Our camper is our real home. Being a member of the National Campers and Hikers Association gives our family the opportunity and the enjoyment of getting out of town every weekend... and to camp with other families. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find the tensions of the day go away when I run a few miles before dark. The light is different, I hear new things and smell new odors like a fireplace burning oakwood. Sometimes I find that dogs are not man's best friend. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We're home three weekends a year. Our camper is our real home. Being a member of the National Campers and Hikers Association gives our family the opportunity and the enjoyment of getting out of town every weekend... and to camp with other families. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I get a lot of compliments on the front room wall. I like Italian Syrocco floral designs over the mantle. It goes well with the Palos Verde rock fireplace. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This is our outdoor garage sale... last minute kids' items for Christmas shoppers. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This isn't what we really want - the tract house, the super car, etc.... But as long as we are wound up in this high speed environment, we will probably never get out of it! We don't need the super car to be happy; (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We've been married two months and everything we own is in this room. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: Tuo-Tuo, our dog, is a very expensive household pet. It costs 30¢ a day to feed him--that's $109 a year--and $13 a month to have him groomed--that's $155 a year--not including the vet bill. We spend over $350 a year, but we don't care. We love him. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find the tensions of the day go away when I run a few miles before dark. The light is different, I hear new things and smell new odors like a fireplace burning oakwood. Sometimes I find that dogs are not man's best friend. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We're home three weekends a year. Our camper is our real home. Being a member of the National Campers and Hikers Association gives our family the opportunity and the enjoyment of getting out of town every weekend... and to camp with other families. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I get a lot of compliments on the front room wall. I like Italian Syrocco floral designs over the mantle. It goes well with the Palos Verde rock fireplace. , 1972

Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This isn't what we really want - the tract house, the super car, etc.... But as long as we are wound up in this high speed environment, we will probably never get out of it! We don't need the super car to be happy; (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: Tuo-Tuo, our dog, is a very expensive household pet. It costs 30¢ a day to feed him--that's $109 a year--and $13 a month to have him groomed--that's $155 a year--not including the vet bill. We spend over $350 a year, but we don't care. We love him. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: The California garage today, out of necessity, requires that you move the cars out and the tools in. To a point I enjoy working in the garage, but I'd rather be doing something else. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: Every Sunday Abe and I read The New York Times and have roast beef for dinner. , 1972

Artist.name: Gaylen Gerber
Artist.Assension_Number: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Purchased with funds provided by the Curatorial Discretionary Fund

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We moved up to a nicer house. We thought we'd do better, but the real estate man got us. Closing costs were supposed to be $295 but they turned out to be $750. They have you where they want you--you've already moved into the house. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find a sense of freedom in the suburbs... You assume the mask of suburbia for outward appearances and yet no one knows what you really do. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I bought the lawn in six-foot rolls. It's easy to handle. I prepare the ground and my wife and son helped roll out the grass. In one day you have a front yard. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: My hobby is drinking. On the weekends I enjoy getting together with my friends and boozing. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I enjoy the suburbs. They provide Girl Scouts, PTA, Little League, and soccer for my kids. The thing I miss most is Black cultural identity for my family. White middle-class suburbia can't supply that. (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I enjoy giving a Tupperware party in my home. It gives me a chance to talk to my friends. But really, Tupperware is a homemaker's dream, you save time and money because your food keeps longer. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We feel most people have the wrong attitude towards sex, that it's nasty and has to be done only in the dark. With us sex takes care of itself. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: It's a great pleasure to watch yourself make love in the six dozen mirrors that line the ceilings and walls. I've spent a tremendous amount of thought and planning to get the total effect of the bedroom. (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE). , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I put it off until I can't stand it anymore. THe rottenest job in the whole house is cleaning the bathroom. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I believe in strict discipline of my children, but they also deserve the right of self-explanation. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find the tensions of the day go away when I run a few miles before dark. The light is different, I hear new things and smell new odors like a fireplace burning oakwood. Sometimes I find that dogs are not man's best friend. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We're home three weekends a year. Our camper is our real home. Being a member of the National Campers and Hikers Association gives our family the opportunity and the enjoyment of getting out of town every weekend... and to camp with other families. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I get a lot of compliments on the front room wall. I like Italian Syrocco floral designs over the mantle. It goes well with the Palos Verde rock fireplace. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This is our outdoor garage sale... last minute kids' items for Christmas shoppers. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This isn't what we really want - the tract house, the super car, etc.... But as long as we are wound up in this high speed environment, we will probably never get out of it! We don't need the super car to be happy; (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We've been married two months and everything we own is in this room. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: Tuo-Tuo, our dog, is a very expensive household pet. It costs 30¢ a day to feed him--that's $109 a year--and $13 a month to have him groomed--that's $155 a year--not including the vet bill. We spend over $350 a year, but we don't care. We love him. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We moved up to a nicer house. We thought we'd do better, but the real estate man got us. Closing costs were supposed to be $295 but they turned out to be $750. They have you where they want you--you've already moved into the house. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find a sense of freedom in the suburbs... You assume the mask of suburbia for outward appearances and yet no one knows what you really do. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I bought the lawn in six-foot rolls. It's easy to handle. I prepare the ground and my wife and son helped roll out the grass. In one day you have a front yard. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: One of the joys of living in the suburbs is taking care of your own lawn. , 1972

Artist.name: Larry Sultan

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I have all the cares of home ownership and the privacy of apartment living. We have an investment in the house. So I find myself doing all the undesirable chores to protect our investment. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This is our second annual Fouth of July block party. This year thirty-three families came for beer, barbequed chicken, corn on the cob, potato salad, green salad, macaroni salad, and watermelon. After eating (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE). , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We've been collecting rocks since 1958. It's enjoyable to get out into the open and hunt for rocks, and it's really fun to cut open a rock and find a gem inside. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I have all the cares of home ownership and the privacy of apartment living. We have an investment in the house. So I find myself doing all the undesirable chores to protect our investment. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This is our second annual Fouth of July block party. This year thirty-three families came for beer, barbequed chicken, corn on the cob, potato salad, green salad, macaroni salad, and watermelon. After eating (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE). , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We moved up to a nicer house. We thought we'd do better, but the real estate man got us. Closing costs were supposed to be $295 but they turned out to be $750. They have you where they want you--you've already moved into the house. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find the tensions of the day go away when I run a few miles before dark. The light is different, I hear new things and smell new odors like a fireplace burning oakwood. Sometimes I find that dogs are not man's best friend. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We're home three weekends a year. Our camper is our real home. Being a member of the National Campers and Hikers Association gives our family the opportunity and the enjoyment of getting out of town every weekend... and to camp with other families. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I get a lot of compliments on the front room wall. I like Italian Syrocco floral designs over the mantle. It goes well with the Palos Verde rock fireplace. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This is our outdoor garage sale... last minute kids' items for Christmas shoppers. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: This isn't what we really want - the tract house, the super car, etc.... But as long as we are wound up in this high speed environment, we will probably never get out of it! We don't need the super car to be happy; (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We've been married two months and everything we own is in this room. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: Tuo-Tuo, our dog, is a very expensive household pet. It costs 30¢ a day to feed him--that's $109 a year--and $13 a month to have him groomed--that's $155 a year--not including the vet bill. We spend over $350 a year, but we don't care. We love him. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: The California garage today, out of necessity, requires that you move the cars out and the tools in. To a point I enjoy working in the garage, but I'd rather be doing something else. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We moved up to a nicer house. We thought we'd do better, but the real estate man got us. Closing costs were supposed to be $295 but they turned out to be $750. They have you where they want you--you've already moved into the house. , 1972

Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I find a sense of freedom in the suburbs... You assume the mask of suburbia for outward appearances and yet no one knows what you really do. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I enjoy the suburbs. They provide Girl Scouts, PTA, Little League, and soccer for my kids. The thing I miss most is Black cultural identity for my family. White middle-class suburbia can't supply that. (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: Togetherness really exists in our family. My daughter and I operate the lunch room at the Valley Inn. My sons work part-time with their dad, hanging sheet-rock. And my eldest two sons work at the Gulf gas station (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We lived in our house for a year without any living room furniture. We wanted to furnish the room with things we loved, not early attic or leftovers. Now we have everything but the pictures and the lamps. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: My husband, Pat, has a theory about watering our newly seeded lawn. The water has to trinkle from heaven and fall like tender rain drops... otherwise the lawn won't grow properly. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I believe in women's liveration. I'm tired of the image of the woman who has the most sanitary toilet bowl, the cleanest floor, and the brattiest kids as the supermother. I want to be able to change with my children (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972

Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I enjoy cooking, dogs, cats, kids, soccer, and living here. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: Togetherness really exists in our family. My daughter and I operate the lunch room at the Valley Inn. My sons work part-time with their dad, hanging sheet-rock. And my eldest two sons work at the Gulf gas station (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We lived in our house for a year without any living room furniture. We wanted to furnish the room with things we loved, not early attic or leftovers. Now we have everything but the pictures and the lamps. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: We had a ball on the Fourth of July. The whole neighborhood came out for the parade. , 1972

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: My husband, Pat, has a theory about watering our newly seeded lawn. The water has to trinkle from heaven and fall like tender rain drops... otherwise the lawn won't grow properly. , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: I believe in women's liveration. I'm tired of the image of the woman who has the most sanitary toilet bowl, the cleanest floor, and the brattiest kids as the supermother. I want to be able to change with my children (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Provenance: The Museum of Contemporary Art, Los Angeles Gift of Gary A. Richwald, MD, MPH in memory of Ann and Marvin Richwald

Artist.name: Bill Owens
Artist.Artwork_Name_and_Year: People throw away a lot of good things: clothes, toys, broken toasters, record players, and in the newer areas they throw out tables and chairs that don't fit in their new house. The ecology movement doesn't matter. (SEE NOTES SECTION FOR COMPLETE TITLE) , 1972
